title: Crispy and Flavorful Avocado Fries
full_text:
Crispy and Flavorful Avocado Fries
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
15 mins
Cook
25 mins
Total
40 mins
Serves
2
to 3 as a side or appetizer
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
cup
panko
(
3
ounces
;
85
g
)
1
tablespoon
plus
1
teaspoon
(
1/2
ounce
;
14
g
)
Tajín
(optional)
1
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal
kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
1/2
teaspoon
garlic powder
60
ml
extra virgin olive oil
1
large
egg
480
g
hass avocados
Chipotle mayonnaise
,
ranch dressing
,
hot sauce
, or other condiment, for serving (optional)
Directions
In a medium bowl, lightly crush the panko with your hands until it is sandy in texture. Stir in tajín (if using), salt, and garlic powder. Drizzle in olive oil, mixing well to combine.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez.
Halve and pit the avocados, then lay them, flat side down, on a clean work surface. Gently pull the peel back and discard. Slice each avocado lengthwise into 8 pieces. Working with one avocado slice at a time, dip in the lightly beaten egg to coat, then lift and allow excess to drip off. Transfer to the panko mixture and gently toss to coat well. Transfer to a platter and repeat with remaining avocado slices.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Preheat air fryer to 350ºF (175ºC) on the air fry setting. Place 8 avocado slices into the air fryer basket and cook, flipping halfway through, until the fries are crisp and golden brown all over, 8 minutes. Repeat with remaining avocado slices. Serve immediately, with dipping sauces if desired.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Special Equipment
Air fryer
Notes
To make these fries in the oven, adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425ºF (220ºC). Bake avocado fries on a rimmed baking sheet for 18 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crisp and golden brown.
